citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The licensee was unable to provide a written program of veterinary care at the time of the inspection. An electronic
version of the program of veterinary care (PVC) was sent to the veterinarian that is being used by the licensee, for their
convenience.
A written program of veterinary care is necessary to indicate that the care for both the health and well-being of all covered
species is provided. Each exhibitor shall have an attending veterinarian who shall provide adequate veterinary care to its
animals in compliance with this section.
Each exhibitor shall employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time attending
veterinarian or consultant arrangements, the formal arrangements shall include a written program of veterinary care and
regularly scheduled visits to the premise of the exhibitor.
TO BE CORRECTED BY: JUNE 24, 2023

2.75 (b)(1)(v)- Records: Dealers and exhibitors
Records of acquisition did not include the births of 9 cavies or 1 lamb. The records of disposition did not indicate the sale
of 4 sheep and 1 zebu. Exhibitors shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the
date of sale or disposal of animals.
Records of acquisition and disposition are necessary to ensure that animals have been appropriately obtained or
disposed of.

The shelter for the zebu is composed of wood. The two side walls have holes of various sizes present. The rear wall has
a large hole present. The front wall of this shelter has been detached from its support post. An interior plank of wood,
along the rear of the shelter, has been chewed. All of these damaged areas leave this shelter in disrepair and not
structurally sound. This shelter should be repaired to maintain the structural strength and to protect the animals from
injury.
Outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from
injury.
TO BE CORRECTED BY: JUNE 24, 2023

The following enclosures need cleaning:
1. Zebu shelter building has a significant accumulation of feces covering the entire floor. Part of this accumulation has
caused the rear wall to protrude outward thus affecting the structural strength of the wall. (see 3.125 a)
2. The cavy enclosure adjacent to the feed bar has a significant accumulation of feces and soil that is about 6 inches deep
throughout the enclosure.
3. The sheep stall had an accumulation of feces and soil.
The excreta in the zebu shelter, sheep stall, and cavy enclosure shall be removed to prevent such accumulations.
Excreta shall be removed as often as necessary to prevent contamination of the animals contained therein and to
minimize disease hazards and to reduce odors.
TO BE CORRECTED BY: JUNE 21, 2023
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
Jeffrey Shepherd, SUPERVISORY ANIMAL CARE SPECIALIST n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The licensee was unable to provide a written program of veterinary care at the time of the inspection.  An electronic 
version of the program of veterinary care (PVC) was sent to the veterinarian that is being used by the licensee, for their 
convenience.  
A written program of veterinary care is necessary to indicate that the care for both the health and well-being of all covered 
species is provided.  Each exhibitor shall have an attending veterinarian who shall provide adequate veterinary care to its 
animals in compliance with this section.   
Each exhibitor shall employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time attending 
veterinarian or consultant arrangements, the formal arrangements shall include a written program of veterinary care and 
regularly scheduled visits to the premise of the exhibitor. 
 
TO BE CORRECTED BY:  JUNE 24, 2023 
2.75(a)(1)(v)  Repeat
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
2.75 (b)(1)(v)- Records:  Dealers and exhibitors 
Records of acquisition did not include the births of 9 cavies or 1 lamb.  The records of disposition did not indicate the sale

of 4 sheep and 1 zebu.  Exhibitors shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the 
date of sale or disposal of animals. 
Records of acquisition and disposition are necessary to ensure that animals have been appropriately obtained or 
disposed of. 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The shelter for the zebu is composed of wood.  The two side walls have holes of various sizes present.  The rear wall has 
a large hole present.  The front wall of this shelter has been detached from its support post.  An interior plank of wood, 
along the rear of the shelter, has been chewed.  All of these damaged areas leave this shelter in disrepair and not 
structurally sound.  This shelter should be repaired to maintain the structural strength and to protect the animals from 
injury. 
Outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from 
injury. 
 
TO BE CORRECTED BY:  JUNE 24, 2023 
3.131(a) 
   
Sanitation. 
The following enclosures need cleaning: 
 
1.  Zebu shelter building has a significant accumulation of feces covering the entire floor.  Part of this accumulation has 
caused the rear wall to protrude outward thus affecting the structural strength of the wall. (see 3.125 a)

2. The cavy enclosure adjacent to the feed bar has a significant accumulation of feces and soil that is about 6 inches deep 
throughout the enclosure. 
 
3. The sheep stall had an accumulation of feces and soil. 
The excreta in the zebu shelter, sheep stall, and cavy enclosure shall be removed to prevent such accumulations.  
Excreta shall be removed as often as necessary to prevent contamination of the animals contained therein and to 
minimize disease hazards and to reduce odors. 
 
TO BE CORRECTED BY:  JUNE 21, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the licensee. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Jeffrey Shepherd, SUPERVISORY ANIMAL CARE SPECIALIST n
